ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Theoretical blockchain concepts and economic underpinnings.
Great introduction to blockchain from an economics/mechanism design perspective
Learned about blockchains and the economic theory behind them. Covered their design, incentives, regulation, etc
Got a broad exposure to a variety of research on the developing economic theory behind cryptocurrency and Blockchain technology.
I learned about foundations of blockchain and analyzed new research in the space.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Explanation of mathematical elements of models would be helpful. Some of the readings got deep into mathematical equations and sometimes got really confusing.

Strengths: get to learn about a lot of different areas of blockchain, good discussion, open ended project
Weaknesses: meets only once a week, 2 hour class can be quite long sometimes
You really get what you put into this class. You cover all the important blockchain papers but it is up to you to read them (you are only responsible for presenting two papers).
Very technical, could be more focused on practical applications/context

Yujie was the strength as he is very knowledgeable about the field and understanding of peoples different levels of background knowledge. A weakness is that the first session of two should have been dumbed down a little (maybe use some video too)
This was a great course in that I gained exposure to a wide range of models to formalize Blockchain technology economically. It felt like an amazing springboard.
I enjoyed the presentations in this course and believed it boosted my understanding of the topic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: highly recommend, great class and not too much work. might be boring if you're not interested in blockchain
Yes, blockchains are an interesting and new space, and learning about them from a more formal treatment is helpful

Yes if youre interested in econ theory. The course is very much so focused on formalizing Blockchain with economic theory at all levels (starting from consensus mechanisms and going to concepts like valuation, security, MEV). I personally loved it and thought it was a great way to gain exposure to new models / ways of thinking. The workload was also very manageable (I had a lot of other stuff going on and this was a good complementary workload). If youre interested in more applied knowledge, then maybe not.
Yes, students interested in studying blockchain from an academic perspective should take this course.
